event.location: Ulster (Province). The incident occurred just outside the village of Forkhill.
event.summary: 03/17/1993: The Irish Republican Army (IRA) assassinated a member of the security forces.
event.weapdetail: A high-powered long-range rifle was thought to have been used in the attack, possibly an American-made Barrett (Light Fifty) which has a killing range of up to 1,800 meters and which fires half-inch rounds.
event.addnotes: Lawrence Dickenson was the fourth member of Northern Ireland security forces to be murdered by a single shot in the last 7 months. One casualty and no injuries resulted from the attack.
event.scite1: “IRA’s Crack Sniper Kills Fourth Victim,” Daily Mail (London), March 18, 1993.
event.scite2: Calum Macdonald, “Scottish soldier killed by sniper,” The Herald, March 18, 1993.
